body_html:
Thanks for the information. This is what we tried to base the change on:
https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/setuptools.html#declaring-platform-specific-dependencies

What happens if you remove all the extra the spaces in the lines with python_version?
For example, the line:

'backports.weakref >= 1.0rc1; python_version < "3.4"',

becomes

'backports.weakref>=1.0rc1;python_version<"3.4"',
body_text:
Thanks for the information. This is what we tried to base the change on:
https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/setuptools.html#declaring-platform-specific-dependencies
What happens if you remove all the extra the spaces in the lines with python_version?
For example, the line:
'backports.weakref >= 1.0rc1; python_version < "3.4"',

becomes
'backports.weakref>=1.0rc1;python_version<"3.4"',
body:
Thanks for the information. This is what we tried to base the change on:
https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/setuptools.html#declaring-platform-specific-dependencies

What happens if you remove all the extra the spaces in the lines with `python_version`?
For example, the line:
```
'backports.weakref >= 1.0rc1; python_version < "3.4"',
```
becomes
```
'backports.weakref>=1.0rc1;python_version<"3.4"',
```
